3: Deep M.I.N.D. is now shaking violently because of the red light pillars.
As the red dots of light diffuse, noises echo through Lucia's M.I.N.D. Her heartwarming memories have now turned into despair magnified.
...Please stay here, Lucia.
No, you're not Luna. You're just an illusion.
An illusion, not an imagination. I'm a story your memories put together.
Nothing that Lucia says has changed anything. Her M.I.N.D. is slowly being contaminated by the red lights.
The bond you've always believed in is the real illusion here.
No... It's not like that...
Let me show you, then... What I've seen, what the Ascension-Network has shown me, and what you're about to experience.
As Luna lifts Lucia's chin and touches her cheek, memories pour into Lucia's M.I.N.D.
Memories of when the planet formed, when oceans abounded with life, when lives were born.
But then comes endless bloodshed.
The few spared by wars bear children, who then breed still more wars.
This is how they have evolved and survived as the fittest.
To stay alive, the weak have learned to be even more despicable.
They deceive, betray, pretend, and lie...
Following this contaminated river of time, Lucia sees a monstrous creature on the other side, having been discarded as if it was garbage.
Lucia... Are you also going to leave me, too?
The monster does not cross the river in time, and its body gradually decays, leaving traces of blood on the ground.
In that instant, the barriers supporting Lucia collapse. Her vision is now dark with the rubble pinning her firmly to the ground, the red dots of light afloat taunting her.
Infected and on the verge of being devoured, Lucia hears a voice.
I believe... you'll return...
Who's there?
Lucia, come back...!
We can still make it! We still have a chance to make a change...!
Are you... Commandant?
Memories flash before her eyes, giving her strength.
I believe in you the way you've believed in us... So... believe in yourself, Lucia...!
She looks in the direction from which the voice came. Right above the abyss, a beacon shines bright, the same way a star would at the dead of night.
It's Commandant's Mind Beacon...
They're all... waiting for me...
With what little strength she has left, Lucia escapes from the rocks and heads for the glistening star above.
...I can't change anything staying here... I need to go!
